subject: Art & Design
title: Textiles: The Technology Behind Fashion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Textiles: The Technology Behind Fashion.

hook.text: Silk was so valuable that China guarded its production as a state secret for 3,000 years. Smuggling it meant death.

buildup.text: Textiles are the foundation of fashion: cotton, wool, silk, linen, and later synthetics like nylon and polyester.

discovery.text: Each fiber has unique properties. Silk drapes elegantly. Wool insulates wet or dry. Linen breathes in heat.

twist.text: The Industrial Revolution mechanized weaving. What once took weeks by hand could be produced in hours.

climax.text: Synthetic fibers (1930s onwards) made clothing cheaper but created an environmental crisis.

punchline.text: Fashion starts with thread. The thread determines everything that follows.
